column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday. Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 476 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday
column5: 469 on Monday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are currently 390 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland.There are 33 being treated in intensive care units (ICU)
column7: down from 36 on Monday.Hospital occupancy is sitting at 103%. Last updated 23 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column9: 054 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Tuesday.1

column15: 632 were third doses of the vaccine. The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 23 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3

column18: 634 on Monday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
